intro: Becium choanum var. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved becium, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils, allowing it to thrive in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
